docs.snippet: Boundaries were of little concern in South America before the coming of the Spaniards. The Indian tribes had their locations, which were more or less permanent, but it seldom, if ever, occurred to them to mark off any distinct lines as defining the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Boundaries were of little concern in South America before the coming of the Spaniards. The Indian tribes had their locations, which were more or less permanent, but it seldom, if ever, occurred to them to mark off any distinct lines as defining the limits of their territory.

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Aug. 13.--A plea for three Latin-American judges on the World Court instead of two as at  present is made in a letter to the League of Nations signed by representatives of twelve Latin-American States and released today with a list of...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Aug. 13.--A plea for three Latin-American judges on the World Court instead of two as at present is made in a letter to the League of Nations signed by representatives of twelve Latin-American States and released today with a list of fifty-five nominations for the bench received from the national nominating groups of forty-two States.

headline.main: 11 AMERICANS NAMED FOR WORLD COURT; Pound, Kellogg, Root, Wigmore, Wickersham and Scott Are Nominated for Full Bench. TEN FOR HUGHES VACANCY Twelve Nations In Note Ask That Latin America Have Three Judges Instead of Two.
